channel.title: math.OA updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.OA updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: $B$-valued semi-circular system and free Poincar\'{e} inequality
item.description: arXiv:2409.16498v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We characterize $B$-valued semi-circular system in terms of $B$-valued free probabilistic analogue of Poincar\'{e} inequality. This is a $B$-valued generalization of Biane's theorem \cite[Theorem 5.1]{b03}. Moreover, we prove that Voiculescu's conjecture on $B$-valued free Poincar\'{e} inequality in \cite{aim06} is not in the affirmative as it is.
item.dc:creator: Hyuga Ito

item.title: Convergence of Peter--Weyl Truncations of Compact Quantum Groups
item.description: arXiv:2409.16698v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We consider a coamenable compact quantum group $\mathbb{G}$ as a compact quantum metric space if its function algebra $\mathrm{C}(\mathbb{G})$ is equipped with a Lip-norm. By using a projection $P$ onto direct summands of the Peter--Weyl decomposition, the $\mathrm{C}^*$-algebra $\mathrm{C}(\mathbb{G})$ can be compressed to an operator system $P\mathrm{C}(\mathbb{G})P$, and there are induced left and right coactions on this operator system. Assuming that the Lip-norm on $\mathrm{C}(\mathbb{G})$ is bi-invariant in the sense of Li, there is an induced bi-invariant Lip-norm on the operator system $P\mathrm{C}(\mathbb{G})P$ turning it into a compact quantum metric space. Given an appropriate net of such projections which converges strongly to the identity map on the Hilbert space $\mathrm{L}^2(\mathbb{G})$, we obtain a net of compact quantum metric spaces. We prove convergence of such nets in terms of Kerr's complete Gromov--Hausdorff distance. An important tool is the choice of an appropriate state whose induced slice map gives an approximate inverse of the compression map $\mathrm{C}(\mathbb{G}) \ni a \mapsto PaP$ in Lip-norm.
item.dc:creator: Malte Leimbach

item.title: Distances for Operator-valued Information Channels
item.description: arXiv:2409.17052v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We introduce three metrics on the set of quantum probability measures over a compact Hausdorff space and characterize them in terms of the completely bounded norm of the corresponding unital completely positive maps. We extend the existing topological structures between scalar-valued information channels to operator-valued ones and associate them with topologies on the set of unital completely positive maps between a commutative C*-algebra and the C*-algebra of bounded weakly measurable operator-valued functions over a compact Hausdorff space. Given a measure on the input alphabet space, we introduce the notion of an almost everywhere defined operator-valued information channel and provide a characterization result.
item.dc:creator: Georgios Baziotis

item.title: Twisted Roe algebras and $K$-theory
item.description: arXiv:2409.16556v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: In this paper, we introduce a notion of twisted Roe algebras and a twisted coarse Baum-Connes conjecture. We study the basic properties of twisted Roe algebras, including a coarse analogue of the imprimitivity theorem for metric spaces with a structure of coarse fibrations. We show that the coarse Baum-Connes conjecture holds for a metric space with a coarse fibration structure when the base space and the fiber satisfy the twisted coarse Baum-Connes conjecture with coefficients. As an application, the coarse Baum-Connes conjecture holds for a finitely generated group which is an extension of coarsely embeddable groups.
item.dc:creator: Jintao Deng, Liang Guo
